Uses of Class
InvalidEdgeException

    • Uses of InvalidEdgeException in <Unnamed>

      Methods in <Unnamed> that throw InvalidEdgeException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vertex<T,E> Arc.getDestination()
      Returns a pointer to a vertex that is the destination vertex of the directed edge, throws InvalidEdgeException if undirected
      Vertex<T,E> Vertex.getOpposite(Arc<T,E> edge)
      Returns a pointer to the vertex on the opposite end of the argument edge, throws an InvalidEdgeException if it is not an incident edge
      Vertex<T,E> Arc.getOrigin()
      Returns a pointer to a vertex that is the origin vertex of the directed edge, throws InvalidEdgeException if undirected
      Arc<T,E> Graph.insertDirectedEdge(Vertex<T,E> u, Vertex<T,E> v, Arc<T,E> edge)
      Inserts a directed edge into the graph and returns a pointer to it
      static void Main.main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      Arc<T,E> Graph.removeEdge(Arc<T,E> e)
      Removes the parameter edge from the edges list of this graph
      Vertex<T,E> Graph.removeVertex(Vertex<T,E> v)
      Removes a vertex from the graph and returns a pointer to it
      void Arc.reverseDirection()
      Reverses the direction of the edge if it is directed, otherwise throws InvalidEdgeException
      void Graph.reverseGraph()
      Reverses all the direction of all the directed edges in the graph, throws an InvalidEdgeException if the edge is not directed
      void Arc.setDirectionFrom(Vertex<T,E> newOrigin)
      Sets the direction of the edge from the argument vertex as long as it is already an end vertex, throws InvalidEdgeException otherwise
      void Arc.setDirectionTo(Vertex<T,E> newDestination)
      Sets the direction of the edge to the argument vertex as long as it is already an end vertex, throws InvalidEdgeException otherwise
